 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָעֵם‎</span>] **verb** ==be pleasant, delightful, lovely== (Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נעם‎</span> ***good*** [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>324</sup> (and many proper names); Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> be ***plentiful, easy, pleasant***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***shew gracious favour toward***, often in Qoran; Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נעם‎</span> ***be lovely, agreeable, well*** [[BDB#Levy|Levy-Os]]<sup>ZMG xix (1865), 178</sup> [[BDB#CIS|CIS]]<sup>iv. 19, 11</sup>; so Minaean [[BDB#Hom|Hom]]<sup>Südar. Chrest. 128</sup>; Old Aramaic in proper name [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>222, 324</sup> [[BDB#Cook|Cook]]<sup>82</sup> (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נעמתי‎</span> ***my darling*** [or ***my songs***, compare II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span>]); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָעִים‎</span> ***pleasant, lovely***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְעִימְתָּא‎</span> ***loveliness***; [[BDB#Prä|Prä]]<sup>Bas i. 46 f.</sup> compare Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be pleasant***, = <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָעֵ֑מָה‎</span> [[Gen.49.15|Gen 49:15]] (poem in [[BDB#J|J]]; of land); 2 masculine singular (of delightful friend) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָעַמְתָּ לִי מְאֹד‎</span> [[2Sam.1.26|2Sam 1:26]], also (of physical beauty) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִמִּי נָעָ֑מְתָּ‎</span> [[Ezek.32.19|Ezek 32:19]] 2 feminine singular (***id.***) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהנָּֿעַמְתְּ‎</span> [[Song.7.7|Song 7:7]] ***how lovely art thou !*** (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַהיָּֿפִית‎</span>); 3 plural, of pleasant words, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָעֵ֑מוּ‎</span> [[Ps.141.6|Ps 141:6]] ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׃יִנְעָ֑ם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְנַפְשְׁךָ יִנ‎</span> [[Prov.2.10|Prov 2:10]] (of knowledge); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֶחֶם סְתָרִים יִנ‎</span> [[Prov.9.17|Prov 9:17]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִמְתָּ֑קוּ‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִנ‎</span> [[Prov.24.25|Prov 24:25]] is impersonal with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ל‎</span>, ***to them...shall be delight***.
